Delaney

McLean

Forward of the Year: Reggie Redding (196-F/G-88) of ALBA

Bayern Muenchen are the new BBL champions! -

ALBA - B.Muenchen 62-75

Bayern Muenchen claimed the BBL title. They overcame ALBA in Berlin tonight to win the championship series 3-1. The guests trailed by 2 points after first quarter, but they stormed back to get the 3-point lead at the halftime and eventually won the game 75-62. American Bryce Taylor (193-86) fired 16 points and 9 rebounds for the winners. The other American import forward Deon Thompson (203-88, college: N.Carolina) chipped in 18 points. Croatian power forward Leon Radosevic (208-90) produced 21 points and Canadian-Irish power forward Levon Kendall (209-84, college: Pittsburgh) added 8 points and 7 rebounds respectively for lost side. Both coaches used bench players which allowed the starters a little rest for the next games.

Top scorers:

ALBA: L.Radosevic 21+4reb+1ast, V.Stojanovski 9+1reb+4ast, C.Hammonds 8+1reb+4ast, L.Kendall 8+7reb+1ast, R.Redding 5+2reb+2ast, D.Logan 4+2ast

B.Muenchen: D.Thompson 18+4reb+2ast, B.Taylor 16+9reb, H.Schaffartzik 12+3reb+3ast, R.Benzing 8+2reb+2ast, M.Delaney 7+4reb+2ast, S.Hamann 6+1reb+1ast

gschID: 320433

ALBA Berlin clinch Cup title -

ALBA - ratiopharm Ulm 86:80

ALBA Berlin celebrated the German Cup title. They held off ratiopharm Ulm in the Final today. Clifford Hammonds (191-PG-85, college: Clemson) scored 19 points to lead the winners.

Ratiopharm Ulm grabbed a 26:21 lead after ten minutes. ALBA Berlin however quickly denied the deficit. They surged ahead for a 45:41 halftime advantage. ALBA cleared off in the third term. They poured in 26 points and ensured a 13-point buffer at the final intermission. Ratiopharm Ulm unloaded 22 points in the final term but could not overcome the deficit. Leon Radosevic (208-F/C-90) had 15 points, while Reggie Redding (196-F/G-88, college: Villanova) chipped in 13 points, grabbed 7 boards and issued 7 assists in the victory. Per Guenther (185-PG-88) responded with 26 points and 7 assists for Ulm. Matt Howard (203-PF-89, college: Butler) delivered 12 points in the loss.

ALBA: Clifford Hammonds 19, Leon Radosevic 15, Reggie Redding 13

Ratiopharm Ulm: Per Guenther 26, Matt Howard 12
